channel.title: [508]How do i know what the coordinates?[508]
channel.description:
i'm trying to make a home command on a pali source.But how do i find out what the coordinates are??
P.S i know how to find the coordinates on 317 but not on 508 :(

item.title: [508]How do i know what the coordinates?[508]
item.dc:creator: @Xseil Xseil
item.description:
@Xseil wrote:

oki daivid was right it is ::coords

item.title: [508]How do i know what the coordinates?[508]
item.dc:creator: @m_st3r8 m st3r8
item.description:
@m_st3r8 wrote:

go into client.java (or whatever 508’s use)

and search for coords if you dont find it, search for pos

if you cant find either of them, you probably dont have it and need to add it yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: [508]How do i know what the coordinates?[508]
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:348946”][quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=445317.msg3269552#msg3269552 date=1279099861]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=445317.msg3269551#msg3269551 date=1279099762]
Just incase you didn’t hear me the first time,

::coords

Every 508 source has it. If yours doesn’t, you downloaded a virus. Grats.
[/quote]Incorrect. There a a few I’ve downloaded which just don’t include it. And no, they are not blank bases.
[/quote]Such as? o.O[/quote]
If I remember correct, that one doesn’t. Might be wrong tho

Just incase You don’t have it:

                    		p.frames.sendMessage(p, "x: " + p.absX + ", y: " + p.absY + ", height : " + p.heightLevel);
                	}
